text: Everything is back to normal?
The world didn't end in flames?
Is Grace still alive then?
I have to find her again, quick!
Mozes my dear, how are you?
What a beautiful day, isn't it?
I come here often to reminisce about this once enormous tree and my late husband Theodore.
We had such nice summers together under this tree.
I miss him...
Life is over before you know it, don't you think?
You sure got that right.
Speaking of Theodore, Jaron found your lost ring.
Mozes, that's wonderful news!
Here you are. One silver ring from Theodore.
Thank you. Now I can die in peace.
Really?
Nah! Of course not. I've got so much to live for. See ya!
Hey Mozes, you can't go further up north from here.
There is a large tree blocking the road.
Hey Mozes, you can't go further up north from here.
There is a large tree blocking the road.
Luckily, no one was hurt when it fell down.
But it'll take a while for us to remove it and clear the road for everyone.

choices.text: Could I by chance help with a horse and 2 ropes?
Curious, when did the tree fall down?
Oh no! That's bad, I really need to be in Honeywood Forest.
Why don't you remove the tree immediately?
Alright, good luck with that. (Leave conversation)
Alright, good luck with that. (Leave conversation)

text: Just a few minutes ago. I heard a loud bang, so I came straight this way to see what happened.
Say, did a tree also fall down here on the same road yesterday morning?
Ha ha, are you mad? Every day trees falling on the road?
Luckily, that doesn't happen.
But it'll take a while for us to remove it and clear the road for everyone.
I'm sorry Mozes, there is nothing I can do about it right now.
You'll have to wait a while. Unless you bring me a horse and some ropes, ha ha!

choices.text: Alright, I'll see what I can do.
I really don't have time for this.

text: No problemo! Me neither. I'll see you around.
Hey Mozes, are you back? The tree is still here, ha ha!
I was kidding about the horse Mozes, ha ha!
But sure, if you really bring me a strong horse and 2 ropes, I will clear the road for you immediately.
You could ask the village elder about this matter.
Maybe he can help you out.
Uhh, that's exactly what you could help.
If you really bring me a strong horse and 2 ropes, I will clear the road for you immediately.
The tree is still here Mozes, ha ha!
We're playing catch, teehee! Can Grace come and join us?
Hi Mozes! You really should check out this priest fella.
He is so funny! Ha ha!
I'm a traveling priest from the city.
Young man, do you want to be saved?
Saved? From what?

choices.text: But sure, go ahead. (Save game)
No thanks, I think I'm doing pretty well. (Leave conversation)

text: Your soul is now destined for God.
Hi Mozes, would you like to see my wares?

choices.text: Yes please. (Open shop)
No thanks. (Leave conversation)

text: Hello Mozes, what can I do for you today?

choices.text: I would like to see your wares please. (Open shop)
Nothing thank you, just passing by. (Leave conversation)

text: Good day young sir, would you like to train a skill?

choices.text: Yes please. (Open academy)
No thanks. (Leave conversation)

text: Hey Mozes, don't say a word. You want to train a skill.

choices.text: Yes please. (Open academy)
No thanks. (Leave conversation)

text: Hey Mozes, would you like to rest here and be totally revitalized for only 1 gold piece?

choices.text: Where were those bats again?
Your troubles are over, all the bats are gone.
Yes please, I could use some rest. (Restore health)
No thanks, now's not necessary. (Leave conversation)
Is something wrong innkeeper? You look troubled...
I heard you've got some troubles...
About those bats you mentioned...

text: Your health has been restored.
Please come back anytime you feel weary.
Trouble? In this establishment? Ridiculous!
Nothing could be further from the truth.
Why, you won't find a better resting place in miles from here.
Now... whoever's been spreading that silly gossip about upstairs is... well...
... obviously just a no good tongue wagger, eager to mislead people.
I've got nothing to hide here!
What's wrong upstairs?
It's nothing. A trifle. You have no need to be afraid or to find another inn.
Those bats never did any harm.
At least not very much.

choices.text: Suppose I get rid of them for you?
Bats! I won't be staying after all.

text: Would you? They've frightened half my customers away!
I'm not brave enough to scare them away myself, they'd scare me instead.
Don't worry, ma'am. I'll be glad to help.
You do and I'll make it worth your while.
I'm not one to overlook a kindness, Mozes.
Then I'd better start right away.
I'm truly sorry for this minor inconvenience.
Please do return to us again on your next stay.
Couldn't you shout any louder?
Them 'visitors' are up the stairs near the fireplace.
Splendid! That's wonderful. I bet those bats must have been trained by an evil imp to harass my customers! Thank you!
There was a reward, you know... five gold pieces.
With these you can have five stays for free, sort of. Isn't that great?
I'm sorry Mozes, you don't have enough gold.
Such a brave yet modest hero! You didn't even take your reward.
Welcome back my fearless boy! Thanks again for your help...
Please don't go upstairs!
It's not eh... safe.
What are you doing here?
Please get out of the kitchen.
Honeywood is such a pleasant little village.
I love to stay here every once in a while.
Meow.
* Druid skill rank 1 needed. *
I'm here only for the mice, there's no way I'll do bats.
Hi Mozes.
Hello Angie.

choices.text: Your horse is looking a little pale today isn't she?
Lennor could use your horse's help for towing a tree.
See you later. (Leave conversation)

text: That's right, Enopa is not feeling well. Maybe she ate something wrong, but I think with just a couple of days rest will make her up and running again.
There is a large tree blocking the road to Honeywood Forest and I really need to be there as soon as possible.
May I take your horse to Lennor to help me out?
She can't! If you really need Enopa right now, she has to get better first.
And then before she may leave, she also need horseshoes, which I don't have right now... So no.

choices.text: Here is some medicine from Elenora for Enopa.
Isn't there anything I can do to help Enopa?
What if I get a medicine from Elenora and some horseshoes for her?
I see. I'll try to find another way then. (Leave conversation)

text: Let me think...
Maybe you can.
Go talk to Elenora, the elder's wife. Perhaps she has some medicine or something.
And about the horseshoes, you may bring me 4 of them. There must be some around here in the village, and otherwise our blacksmith can help you out,
I think.
How did you know...?
But thanks anyway. I will give it to her immediately.
Really? That certainly would help me out, thanks.
When she's all better and shoed, I will lend her out to Lennor and you.

choices.text: Alright, here is that medicine from Elenora.
Thanks, I'll see what I can do. (Leave conversation)

text: Wow, really? That's awesome! I will give it to her immediately.
Hey Mozes, do you have anything for Enopa?

choices.text: Yes, here is a medicine from Elenora.
I'm working on it. (Leave conversation)

text: Great! I will give it to her immediately.
I think she even likes the taste of it! Thank you so much for this.
Now, when she is shoed, I will lend her out to Lennor and you.
Did you manage to get 4 horseshoes for Enopa?

choices.text: Yes, I've got them, here you are.
No, not yet, I'll come back when I get those. (Leave conversation)

text: Thank you so much! You are such a help Mozes!
I'll shoe her right now with these. And then I will see to it that Enopa makes her way to Lennor.
There you go, thanks again Mozes. What a good day it turned out to be after all.
How is my Enopa doing? Has she been of any help to Lennor and you?
Neigh.
* Druid skill rank 2 needed. *
I'm not feeling so well...
Maybe I shouldn't have eaten those delicious looking mushrooms.
I feel great again! Thank you for helping me.
I will fix that tree for you in no time!
Did I do good?
Mozes dear, how do you do?
Thank you ma'am, I'm fine.

choices.text: Angie's horse is sick. Can you help her out?
Can you teach me the skill of potion brewing? (Open academy)
Have a good day. (Leave conversation)

text: Yes of course, I'm pretty skilled in brewing potions.
I could make a medicine, but I'm out of ingredients.
I need 6 herbs and 1 blue jelly.
The herbs just grow here in the village, but the blue jelly is a little harder to come by. It needs to be extracted from a Blue Slime.
Luckily I saw one nearby, also here in the village.
May I ask you to get the herbs and jelly for me?

choices.text: Better yet, here they are already!
Of course, I'll see what I can do.
Ew! Jelly? No thank you. (Leave conversation)

text: I will make the medicine as soon as you can bring me the ingredients.
Mozes my dear, do you have the ingredients?

choices.text: Yes, here they are.
Not yet, I'm still working on it. (Leave conversation)

text: Perfect! One moment dear, while I brew this medicine for you.
Here it is, good luck with it.
Mozes dear, you forgot something.
Mozes dear, did the medicine cure the horse?
I didn't gave it yet.
See that you do. That poor horse.
Yes thank you, it worked like a charm.
And how are you, my dear?
Hello Mozes, how can I help you today?

choices.text: There is a large tree blocking the road to Honeywood Forest.
Angie's horse is sick. Can you help her out?
I'm looking for horseshoes.
I'm in need of tow ropes.
Nothing more at this moment, thank you. (Leave conversation)

text: Come see me again when you've got other questions.
Lennor needs a horse for dragging it of the road.
Do you know where I can find one?
Hmmm...
Yes of course, Angie has a horse. You can probably find her behind the inn.
She often likes to go there tending her horse.
Angie needs them for her horse. Do you know where to get them?
Hmmm...
I think I've got one in my basement. It's pretty dark in there, but you may go and see if you can find it.
And if you can't find enough of them, our blacksmith, north of here, can probably help you out.
Lennor needs them for dragging the tree of the road.
Hmmm...
I've got one upstairs, you may use it if you can find it.
And if I remember well, Jaron, west of here, also had a tow rope in the past.
You could check it out.
Hmmm...
You should definitely ask my wife.
Good day to you neighbour, I'm Black Smith, the blacksmith.
It never gets old to say that, ha ha!
Can I help you?

choices.text: Jaron asked me to pay an outstanding bill for him.
I'm looking for horseshoes. Can you help me?
No, not really at the moment. (Leave conversation)

text: Of course! For 1 gold and 2 metal I can make 1 horseshoe for you.

choices.text: [Gold 1, Metal 2] Yes please.
No, thank you. Maybe I can get them otherwise.

text: No problem, come see me when you are in need of some metallurgy.
One moment, I will make one for you.
Here you go.
Ah, it's about time! That would be four gold pieces then.
Really? Jaron told me it was only three.
That's what I call interest. That slacker hasn't payed up in such a long time.
But I only got three gold pieces from Jaron to pay you.
Alright alright, I'll settle with three for now. It's better than nothing.
I will see to it that I get that fourth one later.
Here your are. Three gold pieces then.
Thank you very much on behalf of Black Smith Inc.
(Jaron, you lazy bum.)
You forgot to take your horseshoe.
Hello neighbour, you're back.
[Dialogue not finished. I have tow rope, but you need to do 2 deliveries for me. Details are in your QuestLog.]
[Dialogue not finished. You forgot to take the items.]
[Dialogue not finished. Thanks for helping. Are you finished?]

choices.text: [Yes]
[No]

text: [Dialogue not finished. Here is your reward.]
[Dialogue not finished. Forgot your reward.]
[Dialogue not finished. Super duper thanks.]
I'm sorry sir, we can't allow anyone to go outside the village alone.
It's dangerous to go alone. Especially with all the monsters roaming around.
What's up with that anyway?
